text: William Charles Fischer (October 11, 1930 â€“ October 30, 2018) was an American professional baseball pitcher. He was born in Wausau, Wisconsin. He played in Major League Baseball from 1956 to 1964 for the Chicago White Sox, Detroit Tigers, Washington Senators, Kansas City Athletics and Minnesota Twins. He later was a longtime pitching coach for three MLB clubs. Fischer died on October 30, 2018 in Council Bluffs, Iowa at the age of 88. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Chicago White Sox players Category:Detroit Tigers players Category:Washington Nationals players Category:Minnesota Twins players Category:Oakland Athletics players Category:Sportspeople from Wisconsin Category:People from Wausau, Wisconsin
title: Bill Fischer (baseball)
